result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody B Dodson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cody B Dodson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Sarah Zwach appeared by video for Cody B Dodson.  Attorney Eric Bashirian in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Defense requested a plea/sentencing date. State to comply with Victim Notification. Defendant requested to appear via Zoom for his next Court date. Court ordered case adjourned for Plea/Sentencing hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46.
Plea/Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Cody B Dodson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Sarah Zwach appeared by video for Cody B Dodson.  Attorney Eric Bashirian appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

**JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.** 
Case in Court for Status of Counsel hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Defense recently appointed and still receiving Discovery material. Court ordered case adjourned for Status hearing . Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
Status hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Sarah Zwach

-received and filed. 
Attorney Sarah Zwach

-received and filed.
Attorney Sarah Zwach.

Defendant Cody B Dodson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Megan Kaldunski appeared by video for Cody B Dodson.  Attorney Eric Bashirian in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Motion to Withdraw hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Attorney Kaldunski is transferring to the Public Defender's Office and no longer able to represent Mr. Dodson. Court held colloquy with Defendant. For reasons stated on the record, Court GRANTED Defense Motion to Withdraw. Court ordered case adjourned for Status of Counsel hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.
Status hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Clerk confirmed with DOC / Stanley Correctional Institution.
Motion to Withdraw hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:00 am. 
Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.

Attorney Megan Kaldunski in Court, Defendant Cody B Dodson not in Court, in custody.  Eric Bashirian appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

HELD OFF THE RECORD VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.
Case in Court for Motion to Withdraw hearing. Clerk previously made arrangements for Defendant to appear via Zoom from Dodge Correctional. Due to logistics issues at DCI, Defendant was not able to appear for today's hearing. Case adjourned for Motion to Withdraw hearing, Branch 46. Motion to Withdraw hearing scheduled for XXX. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

Attorney Megan Kaldunski in Court, Defendant Cody B Dodson not in Court, in custody.  Eric Bashirian appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

HELD OFF THE RECORD.
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant not produced via Zoom for today's hearing. Defense advised the Court of Motion to Withdraw due to upcoming employment with the Public Defender's Office. Defense requested a Motion hearing date. Case adjourned for Motion to Withdraw hearing, Branch 46. Motion to Withdraw hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 11:15 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Cody B Dodson in court with Attorney Megan Kaldunski; both appear by video.  Defendant Cody B Dodson in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in Court for Preliminary hearing. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial. State filed original Information. Defense counsel waived reading of Information, and entered a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of Defendant. State to provide Defense counsel with discovery material and an offer via digital system. Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 46. 

E-FILED: Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Clerk made arrangements with Dodge Correctional for Defendant to appear via Zoom Video Conference for Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Cody B Dodson in Court, in custody.  Eric Bashirian appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Order to Show Cause hearing. Earlier this morning, Attorney Megan Kaldunski was appointed by the Public Defender's Office. Attorney Kaldunski was not available for today's hearing. Statements by Defendant. Court provided Defendant with Attorney Kaldunski's contact information. Court REINSTATED TIME LIMITS. Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary hearing, Branch PE. Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

-received and filed. 
Attorney Megan Kaldunski

Dodge Correctional is NOT available June 27, 2022 at 01:15pm. 
NEW TIME: Order to Show Cause hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 10:00 am. 
Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference. 
Information provided to the Public Defender's Office.

Defendant Cody B Dodson not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Cody B Dodson not in court, defendant in custody. John D Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel.
Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cody B Dodson not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Cody B Dodson in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Cody B Dodson in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cody B Dodson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. AS TO COUNT 1:  Defense motion to dismiss enhancers "habitual criminality repeater" 939.62(1)(b) & "mandatory minimum - repeat firearm crimes" 939.6195(2).  Arguments heard.  GRANTED by the Court.  State to file an amended complaint.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court dismissed enhancers.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
